Dylan Sellers Productions | distributor = [[Warner Premiere]] | released = September 16, 2008 | released = {{start date|2008|9|16}} | runtime = 88 min. | country = {{Film Canada}}
{{Film US}} | language = English }} '''''Another Cinderella Story''''' is a 2008 [[romantic comedy]] directed by [[Damon Santostefano]] and starring [[Selena Gomez]] and [[Drew Seeley]]. The film was released [[direct-to-DVD]] by [[Warner Premiere]] on September 16, 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.dvdactive.com/news/releases/another-cinderella-story.html |title=Andrew Seeley Stars in Another Cinderella Story|publisher=movieweb.com}} It was released on DVD in the UK on October 27, 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.dvdactive.com/news/releases/another-cinderella-story2.html |title=Another Cinderella Story|publisher=movieweb.com}} It is a thematic sequel to the 2004 film ''[[A Cinderella Story]]'', reprising the same themes and situations but not containing any characters from the earlier movie. The movie was shot in [[Vancouver|Vancouver, British Columbia]], Canada throughout January 2008,{{cite web|url=http://www.movieweb.com/news/71/25271.php |title=Drew Seeley Stars in Another Cinderella Story|publisher=movieweb.com}} and was ranked as the number one cable movie in several key demographics when aired on the [[ABC Family]] on January 19, 2009. The soundtrack reached number eight on Billboard's soundtrack chart, with one single charting at position 58 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. It won the 2010 [[Writers Guild of America Award]] for Children's script-long form or special{{cite web|url=http://www.wga.org/content/default.aspx?id=3976 |title=Winners Announced for 2010 Writers Guild Awards}} ==Plot== This movie is a retelling of the [[Cinderella]] fairy tale in a modern setting, with Mary Santiago ([[Selena Gomez]]), a high school student with ambitions of becoming a dancer, taking the role of [[Cinderella]]; Tami ([[Jessica Parker Kennedy]]) Mary's only best friend as her fairy godmother; Dominique Blatt ([[Jane Lynch]]) taking the role of the stepmother; Britt ([[Emily Perkins]]) and Bree ([[Katharine Isabelle]]) as the two stepsisters; and Joey Parker, ([[Drew Seeley]]), now a famous celebrity that has returned to school for his senior year and to remember why he started dancing, as the prince. A school dance substitutes for the ball, with the role of the glass slipper filled by a [[Zune]].{{cite web|url=http://www.movieweb.com/news/NEF41MHILy5yIO |title=Damon Santostefano Brings Us Another Cinderella Story|publisher=movieweb.com}} ==Cast== * [[Selena Gomez]] as Mary Santiago * [[Drew Seeley]] as Joey Parker * [[Jane Lynch]] as Dominique Blatt * [[Katharine Isabelle]] as Bree Blatt * Emily Perkins as Brittany Blatt * [[Lynda Boyd]] as Evie Parker * [[Jessica Parker Kennedy]] as Tammy * [[Marcus T. Paulk]] as Dustin * [[Nicole LaPlaca]] as Natalia Faroush ==Reception== ===Critics=== Amber Wilkinson of ''[[Eye For Film]]'' gave the film four out of five stars, and praised the musical aspects, saying that "the song and dance numbers are so well-handled and catchy, it's a shame there aren't more of them." However, she also said that the "characters are so wafer thin they barely cast a shadow."{{cite web|url=http://www.eyeforfilm.co.uk/reviews.php?film_id=15319 Eye for Film|title=Another Cinderella Story Movie Review (2008)|work=[[Eye For Film]] }} While Wilkinson says that the film is completely different from ''[[A Cinderella Story]]'', Lacey Walker, reviewing for ''Christian Answers'', notes several aspects of the two films that were directly parallel to each other. Walker also gave it three out of five stars, praising the script, saying the writers "peppered this story with a surprising dose of humor and some pleasing plot twists." However, Walker specifically criticized the "glaringly obvious" age difference between the 15 year old Gomez and the 25 year old Seeley.{{cite web|url=http://www.christiananswers.net/spotlight/movies/2008/anothercinderellastory2008.html|title=Another Cinderella Story Movie Review |publisher=christiananswers.net}} ==Ratings== [[ABC Family]] presented the television premiere of the film on January 18, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://abcfamily.go.com/abcfamily/path/section_Movies+Another-Cinderella-Story/page_Detail|title=ABC Family: Selena Gomez and Drew Seely in Another Cinderella Story |publisher=ABC.com|archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20100620064020/http://abcfamily.go.com/abcfamily/path/section_Movies+Another-Cinderella-Story/page_Detail |archivedate = June 20, 2010|deadurl=yes}} The premiere was watched by 5.3 million viewers. The movie ranked as January 2009's No. 1 cable movie across all key demos: Adults 18-34 (1.0 million, tie), Adults 18-49 (1.9 million) and Viewers 12-34 (2.3 million). In Females 12-34, ABC Family aired January 2009's Top 7 movies on all TV, led by the debut of ''Another Cinderella Story'' (1.8 million, 1/18/09, 8:00 p.m.) and namesake "[[A Cinderella Story]]" (978,000, 1/18/09, 6:00 p.m.). It aired on Disney Channel on July 11.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b80120_battlestar_galactica_flies_high_tween.html |title=Battlestar Galactica Flies High, Tween Shows Fly Higher|publisher=[[E! Online]] }} Source: Nielsen Media Research (National Ratings, January 2009: 12/29/08-1/25/09, Most Current: Live + SD, blended with Live + 7, when available). ==Sequel== {{Unreferenced section|date=August 2011}} A third sequel, [[A Cinderella Story: Once Upon a Song]], was released on September 6 2011 {{When|date=August 2011}} in production and stars [[Lucy Hale]] and [[Freddie Stroma]]. ==Soundtrack== The soundtrack was released by [[Razor & Tie]], and reached #116 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] on Feb 27, 2009. It also reached number eight on ''Billboard'''s Soundtrack chart.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/album/original-soundtrack/another-cinderella-story/1161121 Billboard|title=Another Cinderella Story - Billboard |publisher=Billboard.com}} ===Track listing=== {{Track listing | extra_column = Recording artist | title1 = Tell Me Something I Don't Know | extra1 = [[Selena Gomez]] | length1 =
